abstract: The Food and Drug Administration said concerns over bleeding outweighed the evidence that Xarelto reduced the risk of blood clots.
snippet: The Food and Drug Administration said concerns over bleeding outweighed the evidence that Xarelto reduced the risk of blood clots.
lead_paragraph: A federal advisory panel narrowly recommended against expanding the use of the Johnson & Johnson drug Xarelto on Wednesday, saying concerns over dangerous bleeding outweighed evidence that the drug helped reduce the risk of blood clots in patients with serious heart problems.

headline.main: F.D.A. Panel Votes Against Expanding Use of an Anticoagulant
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Panel Votes Against Expanding Use of an Anticoagulant
